column5: My young lad wanted to go fishing when I got home from work so we grabbed the rods and headed to the dam to see if we could stir up some perch or rock bass.  Anything to feed the craving until Bass opener LOL.  My second cast with a mepps landed this unexpected catch.  The picture is not great as I had to take it with my Blackberry.  My wife was with us and has a camera that can take photos with great detail but apparently she was busy taking other pictures    Its hard to tell but the photo is of a Speckle trout not anything spectacular, about 10 inches but great to see anyways.   Here is one of my son with a nice slab of a rock bass    Here are the other photos that my wife was taking when she was too busy to photograph my trout lol        2 seagulls were fighting on the other side of the dam and we couldn't figure out why until my wife zoomed in someone or thing had thrown a decent smallmouth up on the bank   Hope you enjoyed  Ian
Very nice photos Ian. The one of your son with the Bass should be framed. Poster material IMHO. What a good looking lad he is.
Great photos, thanks for the report
Excellent pics Ian.Great shot of your boy holding the Rock Bass
thanks folks.  He gets his looks form his mother or so I like to tell her to keep the peace    Ian
Very nice. What crane is that? The first one looks like it,s a grandfather.Big ole beard. LOL
Great blue heron, not related to cranes.
Sorry,5th pic. I pic the blue out.
